embedded.title: Embedded Subtitles
embedded.imageBased: Image-based subtitle (PGS/VobSub). Cannot be extracted without OCR.

translationTest.title: Translation Test
translationTest.description: Test translation of a subtitle file without saving results. Useful for debugging.
translationTest.searchPlaceholder: Search by movie, show, or episode...
translationTest.searchHelp: Start typing a movie, show, or episode name and pick a subtitle below to fill in the path automatically.
translationTest.noSearchResults: No media with subtitles matched your search.

translations.title: Title
translations.noTestSelected: Click the test button on a translation item to start a test.
translations.noLogs: No logs were recorded for this translation.
translations.loadLogsError: Failed to load logs for this translation.

integrations.title: Integrations
integrations.description: Configure the settings for Radarr and Sonarr integrations.
integrations.radarrAddressError: Please enter a valid URL (e.g., http://localhost:3000 or https://api.example.com)
integrations.sonarrAddressError: Please enter a valid URL (e.g., http://localhost:3000 or https://api.example.com)
integrations.reindexTask: No media visible? Try reindexing by starting a sync task here

services.title: Services
services.description: Configure the translation service for subtitle localization.
services.aiCostDescription: AI translation is very costly in terms of pricing. Only use it when you know what you are doing and make sure automation is disabled.
services.apiKeyError: API Key must not be empty
services.deeplNotification: Please note that DeepL has usage limits and rate limits. A single subtitle file typically contains between 60,000 and 120,000 characters. To avoid exceeding these limits, it's recommended to keep automated translation disabled.
services.localAiDescriptionPath: Local AI addresses usually consist of the following path
services.localAiNotification: API key is optional and can be left empty.
services.addressUrlError: Please enter a valid URL (e.g., http://localhost:3000 or https://api.example.com)
services.freeServiceLimits: Free translation services have rate limiting that may cause failures.
services.batchSupportAvailable: Batch translation is available for this AI service. Configure batch settings
services.overrideUsageLimitHelp: Optional: cap the number of requests Lingarr can make each day, even if your plan allows more. Leave empty to use the full plan limit.
services.chutesRequestBufferDescription: Stop translations when remaining daily requests reach this buffer. Helps prevent exceeding limits with parallel translations.

translate.sourceAndTargetDescription: Select a source and target language. Both the source and target are used to request translations.
translate.languageLoadErrorDescription: Unknown error occurred while retrieving languages, make sure the api key is set correctly.

translation.title: Translation Request
translation.description: Modify translation request settings by changing batch size or retry options.
translation.useBatchTranslationDescription: Process multiple subtitle lines together in batches to improve translation efficiency and context awareness. Note that single-line translations with context are still more reliable and of higher quality.
translation.maxBatchSizeDescription: Maximum number of subtitle lines to process in a single batch. Leave at 0 for no limit.
translation.maxRetriesDescription: How many times to retry when the translation API returns an error (rate limits, timeouts, etc).
translation.retryDelayDescription: Initial delay before retrying, in seconds.
translation.retryDelayMultiplierDescription: Factor by which the delay increases after each retry.
translation.maxParallelTranslationsDescription: Maximum number of subtitle files to translate simultaneously. Higher values speed up processing but use more API requests. Set to 1 for sequential translation.
translation.enableBatchFallbackDescription: When a batch translation fails, automatically retry with smaller chunks before failing the entire file.
translation.maxBatchSplitAttemptsDescription: If a batch is too large, split it into smaller chunks. Level 1 = full batch, 2 = halves, 3 = thirds.

subtitle.title: Subtitle
subtitle.description: Configure how subtitles are cleaned, and timed to prevent overlaps and remove unwanted formatting.
subtitle.ignoreCaptions: Skip translation if subtitles with caption tags exist:
subtitle.ignoreCaptionsDescription: Skip translation if a target subtitle with captions such as Hearing Impaired or Forced already exists.
subtitle.fixOverlappingSubtitlesDescription: Automatically resolves overlapping subtitles by adjusting the timing of the previous, current and next subtitle based on text length.
subtitle.stripSubtitleFormattingDescription: Enable this option to remove all formatting tags (e.g., italics, bold, color, position) from (SRT) subtitles, resulting in plain text subtitles.
subtitle.removeLanguageTagDescription: Remove language tags (e.g., ".en.") from file names.
subtitle.useSubtitleTaggingDescription: Add a custom tag or text to the subtitle file to identify it as translated by Lingarr.
subtitle.addTranslatorInfoDescription: Add translator info at the beginning of subtitles.
subtitle.stripAssDrawingCommandsDescription: Skip vector graphics data (shapes, signs) found in ASS-converted SRT files. These are untranslatable and waste API calls.
subtitle.cleanSourceAssDrawingsDescription: Additionally remove drawing commands from the original source subtitle file.

indexing.title: Indexing
indexing.description: The media indexing schedule controls the iteration with which Lingarr should sync with Sonarr and Radarr.

automation.title: Automation
automation.description: Set up automation. Note that if automation is implemented, you also need to configure the necessary
automation.scheduleLimitLabel: Limit the amount of translations per schedule
automation.defaultAgeThresholdLabel: Default file age delay for translation:
automation.showAgeThresholdLabel: TV Show file age delay in 'hours'

custom.description: Define custom parameters (e.g., temperature, top_p) to include with requests to your custom endpoint. Only modify these if you understand what you're doing, errors can be found in the Docker logs.

validation.title: Subtitle Validation
validation.description: Configure validation rules for subtitles. These rules will be applied when processing subtitle files. If a validation fails, the translation will be canceled.
validation.maxDurationSecs: The maximum time duration in seconds that a subtitle can be displayed:
validation.minDurationMs: The minimum time duration in milliseconds that a subtitle must be displayed:
validation.minSubtitleLength: The minimum number of characters that a subtitle must contain:
validation.maxSubtitleLength: The maximum number of characters that a subtitle can contain:
validation.maxFileSizeBytes: The maximum size of a subtitle file in bytes:

prompt.title: System & Context Prompts
prompt.description: Define custom instructions (system prompt) and an optional context prompt to control AI response logic.
prompt.promptDescription: Define the AI’s behavior and tone by setting global instructions.
prompt.contextPromptDescription: Provide the surrounding context, including lines before and after the current subtitle, to help the AI generate a more accurate translation.
prompt.contextBefore: Lines of context to add before the subtitle line:
prompt.contextAfter: Lines of context to add after the subtitle line:

sourceLanguage.title: Source Language
sourceLanguage.description: The language the provided subtitle line is in

targetLanguage.title: Target Language
targetLanguage.description: The language the provided subtitle line needs to be translated to

contextBefore.title: Context
contextBefore.description: Subtitles before the provided subtitle line that can be used as context

contextAfter.title: Context
contextAfter.description: Subtitles after the provided subtitle line that can be used as context

prompt.notSupported: Context prompt is not supported and has been disabled when sending subtitles in batch.
